column2: Bravura?? Commitment and Mission       At Bravura Solutions, collaboration, diversity and excellence matter. We value your ideas, giving you room to be curious and innovate in an exciting, fast-paced, and flexible environment. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can add value to Bravura and our culture.       As a Global FinTech market leader and ASX listed company, Bravura is a trusted partner to over 350 leading financial services clients, delivering wealth management technology and products. We invest significantly in our technology hubs and innovation labs, which inspire and drive our creative, future-focused mindset. We take pride in developing cutting-edge, digital first technology solutions that support our clients to achieve financial security and prosperity for their customers.       About The Team       Based in Gurgaon and reporting to the People Solutions Manager, based in Sydney, the People Solutions Administrator is needed to provide expert systems support with Workday and other integrated systems as needed.   The People Solutions team consists of the People Solutions Manager and a Senior People Solutions Administrator who work predominately across Workday, but also across other People & Culture (P&C) systems.       One component of this role is to help optimise the Workday system by streamlining business processes and enabling enhancements such as reporting automation and dashboards, providing coaching and guidance to the broader team, training and presenting to business and People & Culture stakeholders and ticket resolution.   The Senior People Solutions Administrator will also be required to support across other People related systems and tools including survey tool, recruitment, remuneration and consolidate and provide reporting and key People & Culture metrics.  ?             What You??l Do           Build relationships with P&C/business stakeholders as required to solve queries, develop and roll out enhancements etc.   Report automation (enabling greater efficiencies for P&C Team and Managers, reducing manual effort).   Improve Dashboards & Manager Self-service ??providing greater visibility for managers / self-service.   P&C Dashboards ??enhancing existing information available to P&C business partners (provide holistic view of their business areas)   Adjust business processes / business process redesign, approval changes, security & permissions setup, org system changes etc.   Automate manual forms in Workday & adding into business processes.   Create Workday user guide content for employees/managers.   Build out additional leave plans as required.   Involved in Workday related project activities supporting the People Solutions Manager and team.   Research Workday related requirements/awareness of potential knock-on impacts of changes & ensure testing /processes are followed.   Run, provide reporting on key People & Culture metrics on a regular basis.   Assist People Solutions Manager in designing, developing & running regular training sessions/materials with business and P&C team members on Workday enhancements & other systems as required.   Drive or be part of a project team for key system projects, such as implementations, large enhancements, or key projects with downstream implications.   Knowledge sharing with other members of the People Solutions team in Workday & supporting each other to work through the activities/enhancements identified by People Solutions Manager in agreed timeframes.   Work closely with the team on more complex Jira tickets, providing guidance and support as needed.         Unleash your potential.       To be successful in this role, your background and experience will include:           Experience of 5+ years in Workday, ideally across the following Workday modules:   Core HCM   Advanced Compensation   Performance   Security Permissions ??Creating new roles.   Reporting   Business Process Design / Fixes / Enhancements   Absence   Experience with Jira or Avature & survey tools will be highly regarded.    Experience in developing reporting metrics and reporting, producing metrics packs for stakeholders.    Ability to build strong cross-cultural relationships and work across multiple time zones    Ability to problem solve and proactively provide solutions to business requirements.    Strong communication skills.         Qualifications           Training in at least 4 of the following Workday modules will be desirable:   Compensation Fundamentals   Advanced Compensation Fundamentals   HCM Fundamentals   Performance Management   Business Process Fundamentals   Talent Management   Report Writer   Time Off Fundamentals   Leave of Absence Fundamentals             Working at Bravura               Our people are the heart of our business. We work hard to provide a rich employee experience and a robust framework for ongoing career development.           Competitive salary and employee benefits scheme.   Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance.   Maternity/ Parental (including secondary) leave policy.   Cab facility available in Delhi/NCR.   Meal facility available   Free Medical Insurance           So, what?? next?       We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion so even if you don?? match every listed skill or tick all the boxes, we?? still love to hear from you.     Please note that interviews are primarily conducted virtually and if you require any reasonable adjustments or would like to note which pronouns you use, please let us know.     All final applicants for this position will be asked to consent to a criminal record and background check. Please note that people with criminal records are not automatically barred from applying for this position. Each application will be considered on its merits.
column11: workday, hiring, cab, administration, impact, medical insurance, global, career development, room, research, talent management, workday hcm, security, recruitment, leave, coaching, compensation, employee benefits, performance management, core hcm, reporting, communication skills, jira

column1: Assistant Manager - NFTE Life Cycle Management
column2: 1.Provide requisite resources for Sales functions for BAU functioning and running of Organization   2.Determine current staffing needs of business, develop talent acquisition strategies and create hiring plans in collaboration with PSA partners   3.Ensure Reduction in attrition and employee retention with quality enhancement by training PSA recruitment team and getting satisfaction survey conducted    4.Drive and meet business targets for talent acquisition Drive and meet NFTEs Hiring numbers as per MOU and Provision agreed by business   5.Manage diversified workforce across Sales Channels Ensure smooth Onboarding, verification and Exit Management and ensure adherence to statutory and regulatory requirements   6.Review and monitor Sales Sites offices across channels in respective zones, ensuring adherence to Compliances like Fire NOC, Land use, OC and SE as per State Laws and other regulatory   7.Manage transition and acquisition of new sites with 100% complied status like commercial site, with Fire NOC, SE, Land use, Occupancy certificate and other compliances   8.Support Compliance, FCU Legal in executing disciplinary action or support required related to investigation. Coordinate with PSAs and Legal to resolve exceptional issues like arrests, manhandling POSH complaints for East Zone   9.Provide details for discussion/ meeting with NFTEs, Managers, PSA, FCU / Investigation teams in relation with fraud case, disputes, customer complains, cobrand partner complaints, Labor court notice, Police investigation etc   10.Ensure cost saving through SLA TAT and implementing claw back as per SOW in Recruitment and verification billing   11.Identify and plug the process gaps ensuring adherence to minimum wages act for all the States and Union territories in respective zone   12.Manage new partner onboarding process and conduct KT session for swift onboarding of the new PSA Partner   13.Conduct partner reviews basis score board and quality matrices, review Compliance, audit, recommend for addendum /clauses for organizational benefits   14.Monitor partners on SLA adherence and recover penalties as applicable and prepare monthly partner scorecard for performance review on SLAs   15.Review and recommend solutions for all NFTEs disputes and arrears pertaining to salary, incentive and FF claims for Open Market   16.Regulate onboarding in Force24, ensuring swift on boarding of selected candidates for each NHO twice a week maintaining all hiring criteria/ rehiring guidelines/ negative profile scrubbing / approvals, as per URN, Minimum wages adherence, NFTE PII and KYC data guidelines    17.Track completeness and accuracy of BGV reports, BGV initiation within TAT ,Immediate action on Negative BGV Cases

column1: Dy. Manager  Manager  Sr. Manager - Plant HR Head
column2: Dy. Manager Manager Sr. Manager - Plant HR Head:  About CMR: CMR Green Technologies Limited   is Indias largest producer of Aluminum and Zinc die-casting alloys with a combined annual capacity of over approx 4, 18, 000 MT per annum. Since its inception in 2006, it has maintained its fast-paced growth by leveraging latest technology and continuous improvement. CMR, which recycles aluminum scrap to make alloy, has 28-30 percent market share in India and is nearly three times larger than its nearest competitor. We are having strong presence at PAN India level (North, West & South) with 13 manufacturing units, 5000 strong workforce and supplies to major automotive industry in India including tier one OEMs like Maruti Suzuki, Honda Cars, Bajaj Auto, Hero MotoCorp and Royal Enfield Motors  Position & Role:   Plant HR & ER Head (HRBP Role)  Job Band / Designation:   B - Dy. Manager / Manager / Sr. Manager  No. of Posts:   01 (0ne)  Department:   Human Resource - Employee Relations  Reporting to:   Functionally to Hub HR Head  Qualifications:   Essential MBA/ Post graduate degree or diploma in Human Resource management / Personnel Management and Industrial Relations/MSW (2 years Full Time) from Institute of repute. Knowledge of labor laws is essential. DesiredDegree/Diploma in Labor Law  Experience:   Around 10 + years of experience in Plant IR/ER function preferably in the Manufacturing sector withminimum1000andaboveworkforc e. Candidate should have at least 2-3 years of experience as Head ER/ IR or 3+ Years experience as second in command in Employee Relation function in large organization.  Job Profile:   This position is responsible for overseeing the entire gamut of HR activities for plants and providing strategic IR support to the Management. The objective of the role is to formulate human resources strategies, systems, and processes that help the organization meet its goals and objectives and facilitate growth and development. The role is also responsible for maintaining security and EHS standards for the organization.  Industrial Relations:     EnsurecordialIndustrialRelation sandmanageefficientlytoavoidlabo runrest & instillinghighproductiveworkcul tureamongstWorkmen.   Ensure Grievance handling mechanism & develop Labor intelligence.   Manpower Planning:   Effective Manpower Planning & handling redundancy with a view to enhance productivity.   Carry out Manpower Study time to time and motivate employees to improve work culture to achieve higher productivity.   Contract Labor Management -   Effective implementation of Contract Labor Management System and coordination of legal cases pertaining to various labor laws  Legal Matters and disciplinary proceedings:   Monitoring all the cases pending before the labor authorities/in labor courts.   Facilitate promotion of discipline among the work force and also monitoring domestic enquiry proceeding when there is a breach indiscipline.   Improve Discipline, productivity, Employee involvement and engagement   Legal Compliances:   To Ensure that all the statutory compliances applicable to the Industrial Establishment are strictly adhered to and to also ensure maintenance of documentation associated with the same properly   Ensure audit compliances.   Employee Services & General Administration   To plan, formulate, execute, review and monitor the various Employees welfare services.   Resource Delivery Ensuring impeccable services to Internal/External Stakeholders intimely, qualitative and innovative way through proper planning of resources.   HRMIS   Management Information System (HRMIS)   Collation & collation of Various HR activities & prepare HR-MIS for Management Review.   Employees Engagement and Employee Relationship Building   Ensure internal communication to employees on key HR/ER initiatives.   Plan & Implement various Employees Engagement activities like Town Halls, communication meet, Skip level meeting, Think Tank, Open door, Family Day, cake Day (Employee Birthday Celebration), suggestion scheme, Help Desk (Voice of Employee) solution within 24 hours etc. for all level of employees.   Drive various kind of Employee Reward & Recognition scheme especially related to blue color employees at unit level in coordination with department in-charges   Peoples Development   Ensure that workmen & contractor Workers better contribute to their work with high moral.   Facilitate skill gaps mapping & training needs of individual workmen.   Job rotation for multi-skilling Counseling     Administer motivational schemes   Subordinate development   Employer Brand Building & Public Relations:   Undertake Employer Brand Building / culture building initiatives for complete transformation at organization level.   Ensure harmonious relationship with Government Official and surrounding community to improve organization image     Liaison and keeping good rapport with various Govt. Offices & private bodies like Health & Safety, Local Police, Electricity Board, Employment Exchange, Municipal Corporation, NGO, politician, Advocates, etc.   TPM/ WCM & Sustainability Initiatives Implementation:   To ensure that TPM/WCM standards are rolled out at plant as per standard framework.   To facilitate & implement operational efficiency drives at shop floor level   Core Competencies:   Business Awareness   Good networking/ influencing skills   Ability to engage with, pursue and influence plant/line managers.   Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills with proven abilities in people management,   Strong analytical and conceptual skills   Ability to work in teams with a diverse set of team members.   Ability to lead and drive change management initiatives   Strong communication skills   Possess proactive attitude, excellent negotiating skill and capability to think in & out of the box.   General:   Age -30- 40 years.   Candidate should not be frequent job changer   Notice Period- Joining period Max 30 Days. We can buy notice period, if required   Location: The Plant is located in Palwal District Haryana approx. 30 Kms from Faridabad

column2: Overview: This position holds a pivotal role in handling and overseeing the Compensation and benefits, Audit and compliance, HR analytics & HR operations functions within the organization for India & International offices.  Roles & Responsibilities: 1. Compensation & Benefits Administration: Ensuring 100% accuracy in payroll calculation and adherence to timelines. Coordinating with Payroll partner, ensuring implementation of maker-checker processes for accuracy. Ensuring payroll MIS tallys with financial ledgers.  Manage employee benefits programs, and ensuring competitive compensation structures. Stay informed on market trends for benchmarking company's benefit programs using industry reports and analysing data from the talent team. 2. HR operations: Manager HR Automation & implementation Design & update SOPs for all processes.  Maintain accurate employee records and databases. Ensures all payroll , statutory compliance related employee queries are addressed within the prescribed TAT 3. HR Policies, Audit and Compliance: Assist in updating, and implementing HR policies and procedures. Ensure compliance with laws and regulations at local & state level. Conduct internal HR audits at frequent intervals and assist in both internal and external company audits. 4. Performance Management: Preparing schedules & communication plans for mid-year and annual performance evaluation. Consolidate PMS inputs, prepare bell curve reports & generate MIS for the leadership team. Support seamless, accurate & timely implementation of the appraisal inputs & letter generation. 6. column2: Shrachi Group is looking for Deputy Manager / Manager to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Experience:    Retail/ Real Estate Sector                Responsibility:    Recruitment, Payroll Management, Compliances- Generalist Profile                Preferred Age:    Below 40 Years      ?       Full-Cycle Recruitment: Manage the end-to-end recruitment process for various positions, including sourcing candidates, screening resumes, conducting interviews, and making hiring recommendations.     Sourcing and Networking: Utilize various sourcing methods, including online job boards, social media, networking events, and employee referrals, to attract qualified candidates. Build and maintain a network of potential candidates for current and future hiring needs.     Candidate Assessment: Conduct thorough interviews to assess candidates' skills, qualifications, and fit for specific roles. Evaluate candidates' technical skills, experience, cultural fit, and career aspirations.     Candidate Experience: Provide a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process. Communicate effectively with candidates, provide timely updates, and ensure a smooth and professional interview process.     Hiring Manager Collaboration: Partner closely with hiring managers to understand staffing needs, develop job descriptions, and create recruitment strategies. Provide guidance and support to hiring managers on recruitment best practices and market trends.     Talent Pipeline Management: Build and maintain a pipeline of qualified candidates for key roles. Proactively identify and engage passive candidates for future opportunities.     Recruitment Metrics: Track and report recruitment metrics, including time-to-fill, cost-per-hire, and candidate satisfaction. Use data and analytics to evaluate recruitment effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.     Employer Branding: Represent the organization positively to candidates and external stakeholders. Promote the company's values, culture, and employer brand to attract top talent.     Compliance: Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws, regulations, and company policies throughout the recruitment process. Maintain accurate and up-to-date recruitment records and documentation.
